titleStmt.title: Miniature Perirrhanterion or Thymaterion Base Fragment With Dipinto

p.objectType: Single corner-base fragment, broken left and right and top. Hard, pale, yellowish-buff fabric, shading towards pink at core; well-levigated but with a few large inclusions. Slipped and polished outside, with elaborate painted decoration; inside slipped and smoothed. Viewer's-left front corner of base of miniature perirrhanterior or thymeterion (taking inscribed face as front); rectangular portion of base handmade and attached to wheelmade circular portion. Decoration and dipinto: rectangular base, vertical face (front side): outlined cruedly in much-faded and flaked black with very crude single dotted-fret pattern within; a single red verticle stroke at extreme corner; upper platform: red, with much flaked black corner palmette outlined in red; circular rising portion: torus in 2 degrees and rising panel to antoher offset in at least 2 degrees; outer edge of upper torus black (worn and faled) and upper edge red (somewhat flaked)

layoutDesc.layout: one line of text in a curved arc around the torus edge

handDesc.handNote: outer edge of upper torus black (worn and flaked) and upper edge red (somewhat flaked); located on panel above

origin.origPlace: Corinth, Greece, Drain, red pebbly top strosis
